Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD erred in upholding the RPD's conclusion that the applicant lacked credibility
Decision_Outcome: RPD found applicant not credible; RAD dismissed appeal
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish credibility for refugee claim
Legal_Rule: RAD must independently review RPD decision and substitute its own determination if necessary
Procedural_Issue: RAD failed to adequately reconsider document-based findings
Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of credibility in refugee claim
Outcome_on_Merits: Not decided on merits due to procedural inadequacy
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: RAD did not conduct independent review as required
Applicant_Challenge: RAD failed to properly assess credibility
Court_Result: Decision set aside, matter remanded for full reconsideration
Remedy_Requested: Setting aside RAD decision and referral back for reconsideration
Outcome: Remanded to newly constituted RAD for full reconsideration
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of credibility in refugee claim
Applicable_Process: Refugee protection division and appeal process
